inference: Solution: Let $O$ be the center of the octagon.  Then $O$ is also the center of the rectangle.  Let $s$ be the side length of the octagon.  Then the area of the octagon is \[\frac{1}{2}\cdot 8s\cdot\frac{s}{\sqrt{2}}=2\sqrt{2}s^2=1.\] Therefore, $s^2=\frac{1}{2\sqrt{2}}$. The area of the rectangle is \[AB\cdot AE=s\cdot 2s=2s^2=\boxed{\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}}.\]  I hope it is correct.

inference: Let $O$ be the center of the octagon.  Then $O$ is also the center of the rectangle.  Let $s$ be the side length of the octagon.  Then the area of the octagon is \[\frac{1}{2}\cdot 8s\cdot\frac{s}{\sqrt{2}}=2\sqrt{2}s^2=1.\] Therefore, $s^2=\frac{1}{2\sqrt{2}}$. The area of the rectangle is \[AB\cdot AE=2s\cdot s=2s^2=\boxed{\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}}.\]
